content:
Kedves FG!

Ott valóban nem lehet, de ha jobban belegondolsz ott értelme se lenne, mert az elsődlegesen a legördülő gomb oszlopát módosítaná, hasonlóan a többi fix szélességű oszlop sem méretezhető. De a lényeg, hogy ha a Dátum és a Méret oszlopok közti elválasztót fogod meg, akkor át tudod méretezni.

A nem megjelenő oszlopokra viszont nem tudok mit mondani, most kipróbáltam a 115-ös és a 128-as verzióban is, nálam mindkettőben tökéletesen működik.

Üdv, Balázs

content: OK, I know I'm replying to myself, but I found a solution for anyone who's also struggling with this. I went to the Gmail website and for each label, I moved all the messages to a brand new label, then moved them back to the original one. This seemed to recreate the label structure, and Thunderbird re-downloaded everything as expected. It was a hassle, but it seemed to work.
creator: teaandowls

content: I do not know why they had no label in the Gmail IMAP. But from what you said that is the case. It also sounds like a gmail issue.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: You didn't explain how you retrieved the five years of sent mail. Was that in backup you did of the profile prior to the reformat? Did you do a backup? If you did a backup and that is the source of the five years of sent mail and the deleted mail, then more information is needed on how you got where you are. Messages received previously would depend on your account's seup, such as POP or IMAP, and your settings for the account.
creator: davidsk

content: Hi David It is IMAP I didn't do a back up as it was my email account that was hacked. All the emails that I referred to appeared when I reinstalled Thunderbird, not immediately but in the space of 30 minutes. I wasn't expecting any emails but just thought that if those appeared was it possible to retrieve any others
creator: chippyrik

content: Thunderbird automatically repopulates all messages on the server. Check the account online to see what is there. All messages there should appear on Thunderbird. You may need to check account settings, but the default settings are usually okay. If you had a large number of messages there, it may just be a matter of time for the repopulation to happen.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks for that I will give it a day or two and see.
creator: chippyrik

content:
brindleconstruction1 said
Hello, I never had to do this before. Everytime I open thunderbird it asks me for my password. I saw one thread that said to go to tools, acct settings, outgoing server, security and auth. and deselect the password.

That is usually a guarantee that your going mail will fail. If you provider requires a password, and the vast majority do, then preventing Thunderbird from asking for it will result in a failure to send.

You also say it is when you open Thunderbird, unless you already have mail waiting to be sent, that it will not be trying to send mail and therefore will not ask for an outgoing password.

Mine does not show anywhere to deselect request password. I checked and it is up to date. So not sure how to solve this prob. Running Windows Any help apprec.

Unless your provider has changed the settings they require (you don't mention who that is) then the vast majority of these sorts of issues are caused by antivirus programs failing to scan email that they have been requested to scan. Do you have an antivirus program scanning email?
creator: MattAuSupport
